content.description: Climb the dihedral crack, crux is midway up.
content.location: First dihedral crack left of the blunt corner inside the woods.

content.description: Face climb with large pockets
content.location: Go around the corner left of Ditch Pitch and climb the face. Start about 10 feet right of Open Book crack.

content.description: Straightforward climb straight up the center of the gully
content.location: Its the second gully from the right side of the start of the cliff.

climbs.name: Rusty Pin
climbs.fa: Gary Schaecher, Craig Barnes, Gary Frazier, Bruce Cyganowski, Bob Bennecke. FFA Adam Growowsky 1970's

content.description: Climb up the wandering crack. For a better challenge, start in the hand crack and work your way through the roof.
content.location: Climb the meandering crack 30 feet to the left of Goreville Eating Society

content.description: Another straightforward climb straight up the center of the crack
content.protection: TR from sturdy trees on top of cliff
content.location: About 20 feet left of First Climb.

content.description: Supposed to go up and left. Hard line. Follow the path of least resistance
content.location: Starts six feet left of Jennifer Goes To Hollywood

content.description: Climb the well protectable dihedral.
content.protection: Standard traditional rack, larger sized pieces
content.location: 90 degree dihedral to the right of Hawks Beak

content.description: Begin up the crack until it ends halfway up the wall. Traverse left along a rounded shelf. Pull through an overhang and climb up through a "V" shaped groove.
content.location: The crack 35 feet left of Rusty Pin

content.description: This is a tricky, balance dependent route. Climb no handed through the farthest gully /crack
content.location: Farthest gully/crack on the right side of the wall where the cliff basically ends

content.description: It starts on the right side of the Short Wall. Go straight up the face towards a cedar tree. The route is named for Ferne Clyffe's Ranger Sam.
content.location: On the Short Wall. The Short Wall is located 20 feet left of Cracked Heart. The wall is not very featured and is a high angle slab about 25 feet tall.

content.description: Begin by climbing through a small overhang on good holds. Continue through the continuous crack that angles to the right.
content.protection: Standard traditional rack, takes small gear well.
content.location: About 30 feet left of Hawks Beak.

content.description: Clim up the dihedral crack
content.location: 6 feet left of First Born. The dihedral crack

content.description: Climb the face and avoid using the crack
content.location: Starts three feet left of I Don't Care

content.description: Work up right facing dihedral around to right-face, up through split in rock to large sloping ledge. move into large water groove/chimney for about 10 ft of crux climbing to slight overhang and "cedar" tree   at top.
content.protection: The finger crack in back of water groove protects well with varied sizes and it has good stances to clip from.
content.location: the approach trail ends at the cliffline.Cross stream to the right and approach the base of cliff which is a overhang/cave. the route starts at right dihedral in overhang. Fashion anchor with slings to trees.

content.description:
Look at the wall and locate two plate sized iron flakes 5ish feet off the ground. Begin right of the flakes and climb up and rightward. While climbing, work towards a black streak. 

  Dedicated by friends to Southern Illinois Climber Margy Roth who died in August of 1995 following a long battle with cancer.
content.location: On the Short Wall. The Short Wall is located 20 feet left of Cracked Heart. The wall is not very featured and is a high angle slab about 25 feet tall.

climbs.name: Goreville Eating Society
climbs.fa: Jim Schneider, Jeff Allison, & Dan See 1994

content.description: Work your way up and through big pockets while angling leftward as you ascend
content.location: 20 feet left of Missouri Breaks. Go up through big pockets

content.description:
Locate the two iron flakes 5ish feet from the ground on the wall. Climb up between them and go straight up. 

  Dedicated by friends to Southern Illinois Climber Margy Roth who died in August of 1995 following a long battle with cancer.
content.location: On the Short Wall. The Short Wall is located 20 feet left of Cracked Heart. The wall is not very featured and is a high angle slab about 25 feet tall.

climbs.name: George Of The Jungle
climbs.fa: Scott Mueller, Dan Caldwell, & Pat Flynn 1995

content.description: Climb the face on the inside of the dihedral. Continue up, angling to the right, and move towards an overhanging point. Pull over the point, and follow the aerie to the top.
content.location: 40 feet left of Gangster. Its an overhung dihedral with an aerie on the right

content.description: Climb up the face
content.location: Climb the face a few feet to the right of Under The Influence

content.description:
A fun romp up a groove with a crack in the bottom. 

  Solid rock.  Easy cruisin'.
content.protection: Traditional route which might take gear in the first third is all.  Usually TR'd or soloed.
content.location: 3rd gully from the right end of the crag.

content.description:
Start at the base of the overhung, rightward angling arete. Go straight up the face, staying out of the dihedral.  

  Note: If desiring to lead First Born a rehearsal is recommended. The dihedral offers the only protection for gear. First Born in recent times is usually top roped
content.location: About 80 feet left of Under The Influence.

content.description: Climb the thin flake until you top out onto a shelf. Top out straight above
content.location: 40 feet left of Miles From Nowhere. Walk through a corridor formed by boulders on your left. After you pass the first boulder look to your right and spot a thin flake. The route begins here

content.description: Climb the chimney left of Quasimodo
content.protection: TR from trees on top of cliff, might be possible to lead with standard trad rack
content.location: Its the chimney left of Quasimodo.

content.description: Climb the hand crack. Takes gear well for the leader
content.location: 18ish feet left of Divine Intervention

content.description:
Start 3ish feet left of the left flake and climb straight up. 

  Dedicated by friends to Southern Illinois Climber Margy Roth who died in August of 1995 following a long battle with cancer.
content.location: On the Short Wall. The Short Wall is located 20 feet left of Cracked Heart. The wall is not very featured and is a high angle slab about 25 feet tall.

content.description: The Main Wall is home to many quality top-rope climbs and a few natural leads.
